name: Sheraton Libertador Hotel

reviews.text: The lobby looks pretty stale but this is a good hotel! I was given a club level room (I'm a Gold only) which looked new/remodeled and had lounge access. Breakfast was soso and the spa did not really look very interesting. However the internet was free and fast. Also the hotel is located just outside BA's main shopping /pedestrian mall and the old town and most city sights are in walkable distance.
reviews.title: Good place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd really go back there because of the well appointed and modern room.
reviews.title: Helpful and polite staff

reviews.text: As city centre hotels go, this is good. Clean rooms, satisfactory breakfast, great location. For its location it was quiet as well. Good restaurants nearby.
reviews.title: Terrible Service

reviews.text: I'm an SPG member as are the two other people I'm travelling with on business in Buenos Aires. We just left the Barra Sheraton in Rio and there couldn't be a more stark contrast. In Rio the facility was beautiful and the service excellent with people bending over backward to help and even giving us gifts for being SPG members. At the Liberador I just witnessed the only two font desk clerks literally yelling at a customer about the fact that the elevator wouldn't work and that he could not have a morning swim, this is in front of an entire lobby of people. The older gentleman was definitely complaining but not unruly or disrespectful in any way and asked to see the manager. The front desk clerks again yelled at him saying "that's not the way it works here" and "the manager isn't here yet" (9am). The rooms smelled of mildew and mold one of our guys asked to be moved, they didn't do it. We are changing hotels today.
reviews.title: well located, clean, 3 + star hotel in Buenos Aires

reviews.text: I have now travelled to Buenos Aires on 4 occassions and have stayed somewhere different each time ( not always by choice!). This boutique Sheraton is one I keep recommending to friends and work collegues. It is a 2 minute walk from Florida Mall. Restaurants, Laundry, money change are all on your doorstep. It is very reasonably priced. Ask for a renovated room and you cannot go wrong! Being part of the worldwide Sheraton group of properties means that minimum standards are applied here and wifi in the reception area is ok. Business centre is basic but staff are so friendly and nothing is a problem any where in the hotel. Would stay here again if I did not want to spend the big $'s to stay in Recoletta.
reviews.title: Stayed here for a conference - was great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Libertador for a number of nights (off and on) as we traveled through out Argentina. The hotel is located in a nice part of the city, convenient to restaurants, the Gallerias Pacifico and not too far from Avenida de 9 de Julio.
reviews.title: We would stay again

reviews.text: The rooms here are comfortable (we stayed in 3 different ones) as we arrived, slept, left BA, returned, slept, left and then returned once again. The bathrooms are nice and modern and beds are comfortable. The people at the front desk were all very helpful and pleasant. One thing though, if you are looking for dinner spot do not take the recommendation to go to Las Nazarenas (a number of the concierges recommend it). We know better than to just take someone's word for a nice restaurant but it was a Saturday night and the other places we wanted to go were all booked. We ended up at Las Nazarenas where the food was good (not extraordinary) but the portions are GIANT and the place is way too touristy.
reviews.title: Great location; lousy beds.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are planning a visit to BA and want a comfortable place to stay while checking out this wild city, the Libertador should fit the bill.
reviews.title: Fantastic experience - definitely recommend

reviews.text: The Sheraton Libertador is in a great location, but the beds are unbelievably rocky. For a top-rated hotel, a pretty disappointing experience.
reviews.title: Perfect...

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel in mid-February 2012 while on vacation in BA and my experience here was great from start to finish. The front desk staff were so personable and helpful - they really went above and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed. They printed stuff out for us and even offered to phone the hotel we were staying at next in Uruguay to confirm our reservation (a big help because of the language barrier). The room we had (standard king) was modern and spacious, had a large TV with lots of channels and a nice, large washroom with a full tub and rainfall shower head. In-room internet is not free, but they have 5 computers in their business lounge area, all with really fast internet and free, unlimited usage. The location is very central and everything is either a short walk or cab ride away (we had wanted to stay in the Palermo area but couldn't find any rooms available for the time we were there at a reasonable price. However, a cab ride to Palermo was about 30 pesos so we still got to spend lots of time in that area, and had such a good experience at the Libertador that we didn't feel like we missed out on anything in the end.) We returned for a final night before our flight home out of BA and were upgraded to a Club Floor room which also included a complimentary full breakfast which was great. Lastly, the pool area in this hotel was a bonus too - it's on the top floor and was a great place to relax in the sun and lounge by the pool. Overall, I'd definitely recommend this hotel and I hope to return someday!
reviews.title: Third time at the hotel

reviews.text: Great location, right next to the start Florida and about a block from galeria pacifico. About a 30 min walk to Recoleta. 10 min walk to Puerto Madero. The room was extremely clean and updated. The room was very big and comfortable which was nice since we were staying for 6 nights. Front desk was very helpful if you don't speak a lot of spanish. Wouldn't think twice about staying again. Very enjoyable stay
reviews.title: "Great location, very helpful staff"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our airline flights made our stay shorter than we planned at the Libertador, but we thoroughly enjoyed our stay there. The Front Desk staff was excellent, and very helpful. They responded immediately to any special requests we had. We would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Great location, great staff, very nice hotel.

reviews.text: Stayed here overnight on our way through Buenos Aires to Tierra del Fuego. Check-in was efficient and we were able to go to our rooms right away despite our early (noon) arrival. Baggage was delivered promptly. Location was convenient to the tourist scene.
reviews.title: Meets expectations.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was comfortable, fairly standard for a Sheraton. The mattress was very poor compared to what I've seen at their other properties. The safe had an electric outlet inside to allow for charging a computer or cell phone. The bathroom was awkward with an inconveniently located toilet paper dispenser and an oddly shaped tub. This was not a great inconvenience, but I think that the bathroom could be difficult for somebody with mobility limitations. The bathroom amenities seemed cheap.
reviews.title: Treated like royalty!

reviews.text: Wow....we were so happy when we arrived here! What a gorgeous hotel....we were treated so well during all of our 4 nights, and our room was amazing.....huge, clean, modern, first class all the way. Great location close to Florida street and great restaurants!!!! Would stay here again in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: Not worth the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading multiple reviews we were a little concerned about staying here but were quickly reassured that all was well. Hotel prearranged airport transfer at our request as we had a 1:am arrival and this was handled efficiently. Nice to have someone there to greet you after an 18 hr journey. Cost was reasonable and billed to the hotel so no cash needed on arrival. Front desk staff were without exception very pleasant and accomodating. Their restaurant reccomendations were excellent and probably provided some of our best experiences in the city. we were on the Club floor so had breakfast there each morning which was Ok. Afternoon and evening offerings at the Club lounge were definitely a disappointment but not a big part of our stay anyway. We had an electric plug short out on us and was quickly responded to when we called the front desk.
reviews.title: better than expected

reviews.text: within walking distance to many of the tourist must sees. HOHO bus a few blocks away provided a good overview of the city. Hotel worked well for us on our 3 day stay prior to boarding our cruise to Antarctica.
reviews.title: Nice hotel! Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was used for our last night in Argentina.
reviews.title: Good overnight hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was great. The suggested places to eat for dinner and both (we went to one for dinner and one for lunch the next day were great.
reviews.title: Very expensive for the treatment you'll have

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was very nice but the view was of a building. I didnt mind this as we were not spending much time in the room so that was okay.
reviews.title: SOLID HOTEL

description: Contemporary Downtown Tower Hotel located next to shopping area, near business district, banking, & Teatro Colon Opera House.
